attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Sir,
         My sister had a love marriage in Pakistan at the age of 18. She settled there for a year before moving back to the UK. When she got here a month later she was told she cannot have a spouse visa as the legal limit is now 21. She had a baby daughter who is now 2 months. But due to the law she cannot be with her husband and her daughter cannot be with her father. Her father cannot also come to see them as he cannot get a visa. Every parent wants to see their child growing up, but unfortunately he can't. Why??
I have seen my sister crying and struggling nearly everyday because of this. This is not justice with my sister and the same with many people out there who are facing the same situation because of the government. 
I totally understand why this has been done so it could prevent forced marriages. But not every marriage is a forced marriage, so why does this apply to everyone. There is a big difference between forced, arranged and love marriages.
There are many people and families out there who do not agree with this law that has been in a way forced on us.

rejection.details: We do not accept e-petitions relating to individual cases
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
